column4: if I didnt have any inernet? i would be screwed as far as performing my options?
i think windows has better functionality without internet
because all the main install comands that i know of are apt-get which are dependant on the internet
so before you use apt-get you have to make an entry in the source.list
meaning whatever you set in source.list the file can be anywhere, harddrive? cdrom? website, ect...
in the terminal i type cat /ect/apt/ect,,,,
it's the same apt-get, but sources.list has an entry for the cd or dvd
sources.list should come already populated with the standard entries
no, cat is an app that does this:  cat (1)              - concatenate files and print on the standard output
you should make it simplier like linux_galore does lol
that is not my output, that is the standard output from "whatis cat"
